content: The September FHIR Connectathon is coming up in just under a month! At the Bulk Data track, we'll be testing FHIR bulk data clients and servers, with a focus on new and updated client and server implementations.

If you're planning to participate and bring a server or an open source client, please add or update your entry on the tracking spreadsheet at https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Wv8uGJwzIm6vchtipc4he3taknn0HTKOxMUFBaQdZjc/edit?usp=sharing .
@Cooper Thompson will Epic be able to bring a sandbox version of the bulk capabilities included in the August release?
@Michael Turman will Cerner be able to bring an early version of the production path bulk server?
Cerner will not be brining a Bulk FHIR server to the September connectathon.

Michael Turman said:

Cerner will not be brining a Bulk FHIR server to the September connectathon.

Thanks for the update @Michael Turman! Do you have any estimate on when Cerner will be sharing documentation for its Bulk data access?

I don't think we were planning to participate in the Track, but we have Bulk FHIR in our connectathon environment, so I can probably set up a group and client ID for folks to play around with if that'd be useful. I can be available to answer some questions if folks are connecting, but I'm not planning on being a full Bulk FHIR track participant. Also, our Bulk FHIR support is currently (mostly) on the 1.0.0 version so it doesn't have all the new stuff from last year's Argo project yet.
@Will Rosenfeld I don't expect to have public doc on Cerner's Bulk FHIR implementation until next year. Apologies that there isn't more to share at this time.
Thanks @Cooper Thompson! I think that would be super helpful, since several folks have mentioned that they'd like to test clients against the Epic bulk APIs.
Thanks @Michael Turman - please keep us posted as the Cerner implementation develops!
Bulk data track orientation is happening now on Whova! For folks unable to attend, we'll be reviewing the slides at http://bit.ly/bulk-sept-21 .
Track Kickoff/touchpoint happening now in Whova!

If you're participating in the Bulk Data Connectathon track please add your name to the sign up sheet at https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Wv8uGJwzIm6vchtipc4he3taknn0HTKOxMUFBaQdZjc/edit#gid=1995302742 .

Also, if you're providing a server or open source client to track participants, please add the details to https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Wv8uGJwzIm6vchtipc4he3taknn0HTKOxMUFBaQdZjc/edit#gid=0 .
Track resources at http://bit.ly/bulk-sept-21
Track touchpoint on Whova in 8 minutes (10am ET)!
Per today's discussion, I hit quite a few errors with the bulk data tests when running it against a configured keycloak server. Vlad and I are going to open separate threads for each one now.

@Cooper Thompson @Aaron Beal We are trying to connect epic bulk test server for connectation (https://connectathon.epic.com/Interconnect-Fhir-Unsecure/api/FHIR/R4/Group). Right now, the export status response is keeping stucking at X-Progress: Searched 0 of 106 patients. Could you provide more insight to this issue
Just submitted a delete request, It's now show 400 error for new bulk export request

There is a component of our Bulk FHIR implementation in connectathon that is busted. I'm looking at. There were a lot of tracks to juggle this time around so I didn't get to spend much time on the Bulk FHIR stuff. Sorry!
I'm not sure I'll get it resolved today, but I'll let you know when I do, so you can do testing outside the connectathon cycle.
Thanks for the quick response. Please keep me posted

For folks participating in the Connectathon track, please add a sentence or two to describing what you worked on and learned to our Track Report Out document in the "notable achievements", "discovered issues", and "now what" sections:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YwlWckE69LXUvSAtgJyzz5OmCvE-NqwE/edit#heading=h.asi4padhvp9a
This will help people who attended other tracks but want to keep on top of what's happening with Bulk Data!
@Bin Mao - can you give the Epic Bulk FHIR call a shot? It should be working now.

It seems to be working , 5 mins in and we are at "Searched 10 of 106 patients"
Update: The bulk export has completed. Files are downloaded properly
